intro: Spachea tenuifolia, commonly known as the slender leaf spachea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, narrow leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels. Native to regions of Asia, including China and Japan, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for horticultural study and conservation efforts.
